div.em: Current conditions as of 26 Apr 16:52 pm CDT

div.div: Partly cloudy, with a low around 51. South wind 10 to 15 mph.
Sunny, with a high near 79. South wind 5 to 10 mph becoming north northwest in the afternoon.

A chance of showers and thunderstorms between 1am and 4am, then showers likely and possibly a thunderstorm after 4am. Increasing clouds, with a low around 53. North wind 5 to 10 mph becoming south southeast after midnight. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts of less than a tenth of an inch, except higher amounts possible in thunderstorms.

Parents - How to Signup for Canvas

b.span: The building will be open Friday, April 24 from 10am to 7pm, and Sunday, April 26 from 1pm to 5pm.
A change in procedures entering and exiting the building:

span.span: Enter the building at the main entrance.
If you have business to attend to in the PK – 5 wing, please exit the south doors when you are done.
If you have business to attend to in the 6 – 12 wing, please exit the north doors when you are done.
If you have business to attend to in both wings, please exit the doors in the last wing you occupy.
If all you are doing is picking up meals, please exit either the north or south doors.

Social distancing, and efficiently entering and exiting the building, WILL BE EMPHASIZED. The hallway floor tiles are 2feet X 2feet. Use that as a reference to maintain 6 feet of social distancing. The administration will be monitoring social distancing.
If you prefer that materials are delivered to you in the parking lot, please text or call
Mr. Cruickshank at 402-404-9869 (PK – 6), or Mr. Lembke (JH-HS) at 712-789-9198

b.span: If you need to schedule another time for pick-up and drop-off, contact an administrator.
Pick up and drop off learning packets in front of the teacher’s room

span.span: Return learning packets that were distributed April 9 and 11, and any other learning
materials previously distributed.
This Friday and Sunday will be the last distribution of learning packets. The learning packets picked up Friday or Sunday will be due Sunday, May 17.
Dates and times to drop off the last learning packets will be Friday, May 15 from 10am to 7pm, and Sunday, May 17 from 1pm to 5pm.
Parents, you may want to bring boxes or duffel bags to pack up personal items. The personal items will be with the learning packets.

b.span: Return and pick up library books.

span.span: Books can be picked up and returned to the tables and carts located outside the library.

li.span: Pick up locker belongings. Locker belongings have been placed in bags with nametags and are in the cafeteria. Anything not picked up by Friday, May 1, will be donated or thrown away.
Return and pick-up hard copies of learning materials, for those who have requested packets.
We will continue to have new packets ready every Monday morning.

a.aria-label: Read more about Updated Remote Learning Plan Instructions

h3.a: Use of School Building and Grounds

span.span: Normal school operations have been suspended through May 31, due to a directed health mandate imposed by Governor Ricketts. Access to the building is restricted to paid staff. Exceptions to the procedure include the Grab-n-Go Lunch and Breakfast Program, and scheduled times for parents and students to pick up and drop off learning materials. April 5th, the Board approved the following procedures for building and grounds use.
HOMER COMMUNITY SCHOOLS
COVID 19 (CORONAVIRUS ADVISORY
SCHOOL BUILDINGS ARE CLOSED 24 HOURS PER DAY/7 DAYS A WEEK TO
UNAUTHORIZED PERSONS UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE.
UNAUTHORIZED ENTRY OR USE IS CONSIDERED TRESPASS.
SCHOOL GROUNDS ARE EXEMPT FROM THIS NOTICE, ON THE CONDITION THAT

YOU MAINTAIN A MINIMUM OF six feet of social distance from other INDIVIDUALS. THE DISTRICT HAS NOT CLEANED ANY OUTSIDE SURFACES OR EQUIPMENT AND MAKES NO REPRESENTATIONS AS TO THE CLEANLINESS or safety OF ANY SURFACE OR EQUIPMent.
ACCESS IS ENTER AT YOUR OWN RISK.
The District reserves the right to close ALL PROPERTY AT ANY POINT IN TIME
Please contact GREGG CRUICKSHANK AT 402-404-9869
WITH QUESTIONS, OR FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION regarding THIS NOTICE.

a.aria-label: Read more about Use of School Building and Grounds

h3.a: Free Meals to continue for students

span.span: WEEK OF APRIL 6 – 10
Monday, April 6 11a.m. to 1p.m.
Wednesday, April 8 11a.m. to 1p.m.
No service Friday, April 10: Friday’s meals will be included with Wednesday’s.
BEGINNING THE WEEK OF APRIL 13 – 17
Pick-up days and times will still be Monday, Wednesday, and Friday from 11a.m. to 1 p.m.
Friday’s meal sack will include meals for Saturday and Sunday.

a.aria-label: Read more about Free Meals to continue for students
